James Carville said it all in the title of his book: "All's Fair in Love, War, and Running for the US Presidency."
 In other words, ANYTHING GOES in campaigns-- you SAY ANYTHING, and DO anything that won't get you jailed for it. You can LIE, CHEAT, STEAL, and commit adultery, and break all the other commandments; ANYTHING that gets you elected is FAIR GAME according to the rules. 
 
 For example when Obama said that "95% of Americans will get a tax cut under my plan," of course this is not simply absurd--it's IMPOSSIBLE. Not only are only are 5.5% of Americans "unemployed," but this only pertains to those who are actively seeking employment; meanwhile at least half the remaining population are neither actively working nor seeking employment, being retired, in school, raising children etc. Naturally, those who pay NO taxes, can't get a tax-CUT; however this is over 50% of the population, and yet Obama gets a free ride on this obviously IMPOSSIBLE statement, promising something for nothing, like Jesus turning water into wine, or feeding thousands with a single fish sandwich.
 
 And people wonder how he convinces the majority that he's the Second Coming-- I'll tell you right now:
 HELLO? He LIES! And the XXXXXX BELIEVE HIM!
 END OF STORY!
